title: Los Angeles County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week; max $100,000 annual gross sales. LA County (excludes Pasadena, Long Beach, Vernon). Initial $597 review fee is currently subsidized; annual health permit ~$347.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand LA County limits (30/day, 90/week; $100,000/year).

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Los Angeles County (not Pasadena, Long Beach, or Vernon)
- ☐ Menu and daily/weekly production plan
- ☐ Basic kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Review LA County's MEHKO pages and FAQ; limits are summarized here.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes planning

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits.

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential and any needed property approvals.

**Why it matters:** Food safety certification is required.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- ☐ City business license if required in your city

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; verify local business license rules.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days total

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate PDF and any property/business approvals.
searchTerms: ANSI CFPM course Los Angeles County
LA city business license home food

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather the documents you'll submit with your application.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay approval and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- ☐ Government ID and basic business info

**Where/how:** Organize files (PDFs/photos) for upload or emailing.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are filled/signed and stored as PDFs.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Fill the MEHKO SOP form covering menu, preparation, storage, and sanitation.

**Why it matters:** This shows the county how you will keep food safe at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Prep/cooking/cooling/holding details
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

**Where/how:** Complete the SOP form in this step.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.
searchTerms: Los Angeles food safety SOP requirements

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the LA County Public Health Permit Application for a MEHKO.

**Why it matters:** This is the official request to operate a MEHKO.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner contact and site address
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Complete the application in this step.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and matches your SOP.
searchTerms: LA County MEHKO permit application PDF

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed forms and pay required fees.

**Why it matters:** The county processes your permit after complete submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Payment method for fees (see amounts below)

**Where/how:** Email your packet or contact LA County Environmental Health (Homebased Food Programs) for submission options. Phone (888) 700-9995 or (626) 430-9855; email homebasedfoods@ph.lacounty.gov. Office: 5050 Commerce Dr, Baldwin Park, CA 91706 (Mon–Fri 8AM–5PM).

**Cost & time:** Initial application review fee $597 (one-time; currently subsidized/waived for up to 1,000 applicants through June 30, 2026, while funds last). Annual health permit about $347. · 10–20 minutes to submit

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment/fee waiver.
searchTerms: LA County MEHKO where to submit application

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate a home kitchen inspection with Environmental Health.

**Why it matters:** Passing inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ All required equipment functional

**Where/how:** The department will provide scheduling details after application review.

**Cost & time:** Included in fees · 1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You receive a pass and any corrections are resolved.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection and keep it on hand.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Final approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by Environmental Health after inspection approval.

**Cost & time:** $0 (after fees paid) · typically 1–2 weeks after inspection

**Ready when:** You have the permit and any conditions noted by the inspector.
searchTerms: LA County MEHKO permit issuance timeline
Los Angeles Environmental Health permit status

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and MEHKO limits; renew as required.

**Why it matters:** Staying within rules protects customers and your permit status.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Daily/weekly meal logs under 30/day and 90/week
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Permit renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Keep simple records; contact the department if your menu or volume changes.

**Cost & time:** Renewal fees apply · ongoing

**Ready when:** You track meals, keep records, and schedule renewal on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

**Why it matters:** County staff can help with specific questions about your application.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone or email for questions
- ☐ Office hours and location
- ☐ Website for additional resources

**Where/how:** LA County Environmental Health — Homebased Food Programs. Phone: (888) 700-9995 or (626) 430-9855. Email: homebasedfoods@ph.lacounty.gov. Office: 5050 Commerce Dr, Baldwin Park, CA 91706. Hours: Mon–Fri 8AM–5PM. Website: publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/business/microenterprise-home-kitchen-operation.htm

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies by question

**Ready when:** You have the information you need to proceed.

title: San Diego County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales (adjusted). No signage; food must be prepared, cooked, and served/delivered the same day.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand core limits.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in San Diego County
- ☐ Menu and daily/weekly production plan (≤30/day, ≤90/week)
- ☐ Basic kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Review San Diego County's MEHKO overview and Quick Facts.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes planning

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits.
searchTerms: San Diego MEHKO daily meal limits
San Diego MEHKO weekly meal restrictions
San Diego Home Kitchen Operations rules

steps.content:

**Why it matters:** Food safety certification is required and property rules may apply.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- ☐ City business license if required in your jurisdiction

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; check local business license rules.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days total (study + exam)

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate PDF and any property/business approvals.

San Diego business license home food operation

**Where/how:** Complete the SOP form in this step.

steps.title: Health Permit Application

- ☐ Owner contact and site address
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees

**Where/how:** Email forms to FHDMEHKO@sdcounty.ca.gov or submit in person at 5500 Overland Ave., 1st Floor, San Diego, CA 92123. Pay online after invoicing at dehqpay.com, by mail to P.O. Box 129261, San Diego, CA 92112-9261, or in person.

**Cost & time:** Initial permit $646 · Annual renewal $322 · 10–20 minutes to submit (processing varies)

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.
searchTerms: San Diego Environmental Health submission MEHKO

title: Alameda County MEHKO
description: Home-based kitchen permit: prepare and serve up to 30 meals/day, 90/week; max $100,000 gross annual sales. Requires SOP, Health Permit, Food Safety Manager, and Food Handler cards; $696 permit fee.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Review MEHKO rules, limits, and permit process.

**Why it matters:** Understanding key requirements (meals, sales, personnel, safety) up front avoids delays.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Meal limits: 30/day, 90/week; gross annual sales ≤ $100,000
- ☐ Same-day preparation and service only
- ☐ No signage or outdoor advertising
- ☐ Understand prohibited processes and foods (e.g., HACCP, raw milk, raw oysters)

**Where/how:** Visit Alameda County DEH's Home-Based Food Business page and review the MEHKO SOP and flyer.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** You understand the main rules and your operation plan fits them.
searchTerms: Alameda County MEHKO limits 30 meals 90 week
Alameda County MEHKO prohibited foods HACCP

steps.title: Download & Fill MEHKO Application/SOP
steps.content:
**What to do:** Download and complete the MEHKO Application / Standard Operating Procedures form.

**Why it matters:** This combined form documents how your operation complies with MEHKO regulations.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and schedule (meals/day, week)
- ☐ Advertising plan (no signage; list IFSI or website)
- ☐ Safety plan (water, refuse, grease, ventilation, hygiene, animals)
- ☐ Certifications: Food Safety Manager, Food Handler cards

**Where/how:** Download the form from this step and fill it out.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 45–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP form is fully filled and your operational details and safety plan are documented.
searchTerms: Alameda County MEHKO Application SOP PDF

steps.title: Get Certifications
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain required food safety certificates.

**Why it matters:** DEH requires credentials for you and anyone involved in food handling.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Food Safety Manager certification (approved/accredited)
- ☐ Food handler card for any employees (excluding household members)

**Where/how:** Take DEH-approved courses for the manager certificate; get Food Handler cards via a recognized provider.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$150 · 1–2 days total

**Ready when:** You have valid certificates for all relevant individuals.
searchTerms: Alameda County food safety manager certification
Alameda County food handler card MEHKO

steps.title: Submit Application & Pay
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit your completed SOP/Application and pay the permit fee.

**Why it matters:** Payment triggers DEH to begin review and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed MEHKO Application/SOP
- ☐ Certification copies
- ☐ Payment for permit: $696.00

**Where/how:** Submit in person or by mail to Alameda County DEH at 1131 Harbor Bay Parkway, Alameda, CA 94502.

**Cost & time:** $696.00 · proceed upon submission

**Ready when:** DEH acknowledges receipt and begins processing.

steps.title: Initial Kitchen Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Prepare for and complete the in-person inspection at your home.

**Why it matters:** This verifies your setup meets safety and zoning requirements.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen, storage, restrooms, refuse area in clean, working order
- ☐ SOP/Application available for review
- ☐ Hygiene facilities and waste/grease disposal plan ready

**Where/how:** DEH will schedule an inspection after application review.

**Cost & time:** Included in application fee · about 1–2 hrs on inspection day

**Ready when:** Inspector approves your setup and allows permit issuance.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain and keep your MEHKO operating permit.

**Why it matters:** You must have this permit before legally operating your MEHKO.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Permit document issued by DEH
- ☐ Keep SOP and certificates handy for reference and compliance

**Where/how:** DEH will issue the permit after a successful inspection.

**Cost & time:** Included in fee; valid per county regulations

**Ready when:** Permit is issued and you’re officially approved to operate.

steps.title: Operate & Comply
steps.content:
**What to do:** Operate your MEHKO following rules and maintain records.

**Why it matters:** Staying compliant avoids enforcement actions.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Track meals (≤ 30/day, 90/week) and gross sales (≤ $100,000/year)
- ☐ Follow same-day prep/serve rule
- ☐ No signage; use approved IFSIs or online ads only
- ☐ Renew permit per DEH schedule

**Where/how:** Keep logs, SOP manual, and proof of compliance accessible.

**Cost & time:** Ongoing; minimal weekly tracking

**Ready when:** You're consistently operating legally and ready for any follow-up checks.

steps.title: Contact Information
steps.content:
**What to do:** Save DEH contact info for questions or assistance.

**Why it matters:** Quick support helps avoid missteps and delays.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Address & office: 1131 Harbor Bay Parkway, Alameda, CA 94502
- ☐ Phone: (510) 567-6700
- ☐ Website: deh.acgov.org

**Where/how:** Use this info for submissions, follow-up, or general support.

**Cost & time:** $0 · As needed

**Ready when:** You have DEH’s contact info clearly logged.
